node.title: Anticipating a Deed, They Said ‘I Do’
node.description: Peter Vidani and Jennifer Pierce decided to celebrate their almost-finalized purchase of a Clinton Hill townhouse by getting married in it.
node.content: ["When Peter Vidani and Jennifer Pierce attended an open house in September for a townhouse in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, a few blocks east of Fort Greene Park, Mr. Vidani felt like the couple \u2014 who had relocated from California at the beginning of the year \u2014 had found their dream home.", "Ms. Pierce, though, said she \u201cneeded a little more time to say, \u2018Yes, let\u2019s go for it.\u2019\u201d", "She came around soon enough: six days after first seeing it, they put in an offer. Then came a bidding war, which they lost.", "\u201cWe had to tell ourselves it wasn\u2019t meant to be,\u201d Mr. Vidani said.", "But when the sellers\u2019 listing agent later returned to the couple\u2019s listing agent with an update that the other deal had fallen through, \u201cit was hard to not think in a romantic way that it was meant to be,\u201d he said. They put in another offer, which was accepted in September. (The sale is currently closing.)", "On Nov. 12, Mr. Vidani, 35, and Ms. Pierce, 33, who became in engaged in May, celebrated the almost-finalized purchase of their new home by getting married in it. Given that neither grew up in New York \u2014 he is from Wisconsin, she is from California \u2014 Mr. Vidani said it was the only place they could think of \u201cthat was special enough to have meaning.\u201d", "They wed in the parlor, surrounded by their parents and Mr. Vidani\u2019s brother, who served as the witness. Celine Eid of Honeybreak Officiants, who was ordained by the Universal Life Church, officiated. Also in attendance was a colleague of the sellers\u2019 listing agent, who had to let everyone inside.", "Afterward, the newlyweds shared a Champagne toast with their guests and gave them a tour of the house, still staged with furniture for showings. One of the sellers of the home, a painter, left the couple a wedding gift, they said: a black-and-white watercolor print of a flame in a candle. (They plan to hang it in the entryway.)", "Dinner with their guests at Gramercy Tavern followed, as did a stay at the Ludlow Hotel in Manhattan.", "While the couple\u2019s house hunting had a rocky start, their relationship did not.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "Mr. Vidani and Ms. Pierce met around Thanksgiving 2018, through the dating app Hinge. Her profile noted she was looking for a partner who, among other things, is funny and laughs a lot. She realized they had a shared sense of humor by their second date, on which they spent six hours wandering the city of Oakland, Calif. (Ms. Pierce was living in Berkeley at the time, and Mr. Vidani in San Francisco.)", "\u201cPeter\u2019s just so funny and he was cracking me up,\u201d Ms. Pierce said. \u201cWe have a light way of looking at the world.\u201d", "But Ms. Pierce, who received bachelor\u2019s and law degrees from the University of California, Berkeley, and works as an attorney for the Environmental Protection Agency, also has a serious side, which Mr. Vidani said complements his \u201coff-the-cuff\u201d personality.", "\u201cJenny is a much more organized person in general,\u201d said Mr. Vidani, who dropped out of the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee to co-found Tumblr and now works as a senior vice president at Salesforce.", "By January 2019, they made their relationship official. In February 2020, Ms. Pierce moved into Mr. Vidani\u2019s San Francisco home, weeks before the coronavirus pandemic hit.", "\u201cIt was a huge challenge to navigate a changed world, and I was so grateful to be with Peter,\u201d Ms. Pierce said.", "Wanting to try something new, the couple moved to New York in January, into a rental a few blocks from the home they will soon own.", "Their new home, the couple said, will hopefully be a long-term one where they\u2019ll raise a family \u2014 and, one day, tell their children the story of how they married in the parlor.", "\u201cMaybe there will be a picture of it in there,\u201d Mr. Vidani said."]
